                pageLevel = pageLevel + '-oom';

</p>
<h1 class="title">
Boil order issued for part of south KC after water main breaks
</h1>
</div>
<div class="row story-rail-wrapper ">
<div class="wide-rail ">
<div class="toplines ">
<p>The Kansas City Water Department has issued a boil water advisory, effective immediately and expected to last for up to 48 hours. The affected area includes both sides of 135th Street south to the city limits and Holmes Road to State Line Road.</p>
</div>

</div>

<div class="dateline-storybody ">
<div class="clearfix " id="story-target">
<div id="content-body-16193705-299797">
<p>The Kansas City Water Department has issued a boil water advisory, effective immediately and expected to last for up to 48 hours.</p>
<p>The affected area includes both sides of 135th Street south to the city limits and Holmes Road to State Line Road. </p>
<p>The advisory is due to a 12–inch water main break that occurred at 139th Street and Wyandotte Road and caused a drop in water pressure.</p>
<p>Customers should boil all drinking water vigorously for three minutes before using it to drink, cook, or prepare food. Ice made with un-boiled water should not be used for drinking. Disinfect dishes and food contact surfaces with tap water that contains one teaspoon of household bleach per gallon.</p>
<p>
</p>
<span class="endnote">| Lynn Horsley, lhorsley@kcstar.com.
</span>
</div>

/* Check if user scrolls to the share tools but grab it 50px early
* to accommodate the top: 50px CSS once sticky'd (this eliminates
* the slight jump in the beginning).
*/
if ( isSticky === false && scrollTop > storyBodyTop && scrollTop < commentingTop ) {
isSticky = true;
return $shareTools.toggleClass('sticky-tools');
}
if ( isSticky === true && ( scrollTop >= commentingTop || scrollTop < storyBodyTop ) ) {
isSticky = false;
return $shareTools.toggleClass('sticky-tools'); }
};
stickyTools();
$window.on("scroll", stickyTools);
//Story Numberlines
var rearrangeHighline = function() {
var $this = $(this);
var $leadIn = $this.find('.ng_number_leadin').detach();
$this.wrapInner('<span></span>');
$this.prepend($leadIn);
};
$('.highline-number').find('p').each(rearrangeHighline);
});
</script>

News

Boil order issued for south side Hannibal neighborhood

Posted: Dec. 14, 2011 1:27 pm Updated: Jan. 11, 2012 6:15 pm

The Hannibal Board of Public Works has issued a 48-hour boil notice for a neighborhood on the south side of Hannibal where a water main broke Tuesday morning.

The area is bounded to the north by 36th Street, to the south by Singleton Avenue, to the west by Hamilton Street and to the east by Mildred Street.

The utility reported shortly after 8 a.m. that a 6-inch water main at 36th and Vivian streets had broken.

Onondaga County health, water officials announce boil-water advisory for Salina neighborhood

Print Email
John Mariani | jmariani@syracuse.com By John Mariani | jmariani@syracuse.com The Post-Standard
Follow on Twitter
on December 14, 2011 at 2:59 PM, updated December 14, 2011 at 3:31 PM
comments

Salina, NY – The water is back on in Salina's Woods Edge neighborhood, but residents on the streets that lost service should consider boiling their tap water, Onondaga County Water Authority officials said.





Workers turned off water about 8:15 a.m. to approximately 80 homes on Cleveland and Garfield avenues, Footprint Circle and Ausable Row so they could fix a broken 6-inch water main, said Michael E. Hooker, OCWA’s executive director. The neighborhood is north of Onondaga Lake Park, west of Liverpool and south of the state Thruway.

Service was restored about 12:45 p.m.

Because of the length of the outage, the county Health Department is advising affected customers to boil their tap water as a precaution against any harmful germs that may have gotten into the system, Hooker said. Notices have been hand-delivered to those customers.

The advisory may remain in effect up to two days, Hooker said. The water is being tested and officials will announce in another hand-delivered notice when the advisory is lifted.

Affected customers whose water is cloudy or discolored should let their taps run until the water is clear. OCWA workers are flushing mains in the area to restore normal service.

<p>CHARLESTON, W.Va. --West Virginia American Water has issued a boil-water advisory for customers in the Indian Meadows, Breckenridge and Wildwood Oaks subdivisions of <strong>Ona</strong>. The advisory was issued after a scheduled disruption in water service while repairs were made Tuesday. A water tanker with potable water will be parked by the storage buildings near the entrance to the Indian Meadows subdivision through Wednesday. Customers are encouraged to bring their own containers and fill them up as needed.Once water service has been restored, customers in those areas are urged to boil their water for at least one full minute before use, until further notice. For more information, contact West Virginia American Water's customer service center at 800-685-8660.</p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><li>nn</li><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-608360">
<div class="tnt-ads-container text-center ">
<div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-refreshable="true" id="ad-608360" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;">
<script>
                googletag.cmd.push(function() {
                    googletag.display('ad-608360');
                    
                });
            </script>
</div>
</div>
</div></div><p>A boil-water advisory also has been issued for customers from W.Va. 92 West to Drewery Avenue in <strong>White Sulphur Springs</strong>. Customers in those areas also should boil their water for at least one full minute before use.</p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-608361">

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

            var bloxServiceVerified = $.cookie('tncms-services-verified');

            /* if service not whitelisted check user service */
            if( bloxServiceVerified != 1 ){
                var bloxServiceIDs = [];
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5009);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5605);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4655);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4978);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4656);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4657);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5353);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4608);
                
                if (__tnt.user.services){
                    var bloxUserServiceIDs = __tnt.user.services.replace('%2C',',').split(',');
                    $.each(bloxUserServiceIDs, function(index, value){
                        var serviceID = parseInt(value);
                        if( serviceID != 0 ){
                            if( $.inArray(serviceID, bloxServiceIDs) > -1 ){
                                bloxHasSubscription = true;
                                return false;
                            }
                        }else{
                            bloxHasSubscription = true;
                            return false;
                        }
                    });
                }
            /* service has been whitelisted */
            } else {
                bloxHasSubscription = true;
            }

            /* check for whitelists once per day */
            if( !bloxHasSubscription && !bloxServiceVerified && typeof userWhiteList != 'undefined' && $.isArray(userWhiteList) ) {
                $.getJSON("http://www.nwitimes.com/_services/v1/client_ip_info",function(data){
                    /* create a range */
                    var dataRange = data.ip.split('.');
                    dataRange = dataRange[0]+'.'+dataRange[1]+'.'+dataRange[2];
                    if( jQuery.inArray(data.ip, userWhiteList) > -1 || jQuery.inArray(dataRange, userWhiteList) > -1 ){
                        /* white list machine */
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 1, { path:'/' });

                        bloxHasSubscription = true;
                    } else {
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 0, { path:'/', expires:1 });
                        
                        __tnt.metering.check();
                    }
                });

            /* no access */
            }else if( !bloxHasSubscription ){
                __tnt.metering.check();
            }
            
            if(bloxHasSubscription){
                $('.subscriber-only.encrypted-content').each(function(){
                    $(this).html(tncms.unscramble($(this).text()));
                    $(this).show();
                });
                $('.subscriber-hide').show();
            }

            // show main content div

            $('.subscriber-load').hide();

<div class="asset-content p402_premium subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>EAST CHICAGO | A citywide boil order remains in effect for at
least another day, but officials said Tuesday that emergency
repairs to the city's water system appear to have been
successful.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-preview"><p>Only minor problems have been reported since service was
restored Monday afternoon after a Sunday morning break in a primary
water main left East Chicago without water for 36 hours, said
Herbert Cruz, emergency management director.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Restaurants were reopened Tuesday after visits from Health
Department inspectors who made sure workers were following the boil
order and other conditions for food handling, according to owners
in the downtown and Indiana Harbor areas.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/nwitimes.com/news/local/lake/east-chicago" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-top, atf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-top-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>A residential water line on Franklin Street in the Prairie Park
area that began leaking after pressure was restored was repaired
shortly after noon on Tuesday, according to a Street Department
supervisor on the scene.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>There was a bit of a scare Monday night when word came in that
Canal Street on the city's far North Side was flooded, Cruz said,
but the water came from a fire hydrant that had been sheared off by
a semi-truck, and the shutoff was handled with normal
procedures.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Water for the 193 residents of the John B. Nicosia Senior
Citizens Building on Railroad Avenue was restored Tuesday morning
after sediment blocking the facility's valves was removed, Cruz
said.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center "><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/nwitimes.com/news/local/lake/east-chicago" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-inline-video, stf" data-dfp-size="[4,1]" data-lazy="true" id="fixed-inline-video" style="min-height:1px; min-width:4px;"></div></div>
<div class="subscriber-only"><p>Filtration plant technicians said their first tests for bacteria
in the water system were conducted around 9:30 a.m. Tuesday, and it
takes 24 hours to obtain results.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>State and federal laws require a second successful 24-hour test
before the water can be declared safe, so the boil order will
remain in effect until at least Thursday morning.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/nwitimes.com/news/local/lake/east-chicago" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-middle, stf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-middle-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Emergency management workers on Tuesday continued to deliver
drinking water to senior citizens throughout the city, Cruz said,
and his department was working closely with St. Catherine Hospital
staff to continue normal operations there.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>"So far, so good," Cruz said Tuesday afternoon.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>"A lot of residents and merchants have really stepped up to help
us get through this with donations of time and material. I've been
keeping a list, and when things ease up I want everybody to get
some recognition."</p>
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-1369863"><section class="block emphasis-h3 dark " id="block-1369863">

</h3>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

<div class="infinity-summary-container hidden-print" id="infinite-container">
<div data-next-url="http://www.nwitimes.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=c68a30f6-27a1-59d3-a6a0-c3996657a052&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube" id="infinite-more">
<i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i>
</div>
</div>
<script>
        
            var bFoundOrigin = true;
            var sOriginID = null;
        
        var sOriginURL = scrubURL('http://www.nwitimes.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=c68a30f6-27a1-59d3-a6a0-c3996657a052&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube'); // original url scrubbed for preview
        var sFirstID = null;
        var bFirstRun = true;
        var bShowAd = true;
        var bInfiniStop = false;

        function populateInfinitySet(sURL) {
            sURL = scrubURL(sURL);

            // Until the origin paramter for cms.search.mlt functions, we have to start/stop the looping on our own
            // This will require not displaying any assets until we hit oAsset.
            // Then we loop through and display until we've been through everything up to our origin

            $.ajax(sURL).then(function(oResponse, sStatus, oXHR) {

                var sNextUrl = null;

                if (typeof oResponse.next_url == 'undefined') {
                    // URL supplied is no good. Revert to original URL
                    sNextUrl = sOriginURL;
                } else {
                    sNextUrl = scrubURL(oResponse.next_url);
                }

                // Manage response
                if (typeof oResponse.assets != 'undefined' && oResponse.assets.length > 0) {
                    
                    // Remove old more data
                    $("#infinite-more").remove();

                    
                    // Build infinity set
                    $.each(oResponse.assets, function(index) {
                            if (index == 1 && sOriginID == null) {
                                sOriginID = oResponse.assets[0].id;
                            }
                        // Display assets once origin is found
                        if (bFoundOrigin == true) {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                bInfiniStop = true;
                                sNextUrl = null;
                                $("#infinite-more").remove();
                                
                            } else if (bInfiniStop == false && this.id != 'c68a30f6-27a1-59d3-a6a0-c3996657a052') {
                                // Display asset
                                var sHTML = '';
                                if (this.content) {
                                    sHTML += '<div class="infinite-item original row"><div class="col-md-8">' + this.content + '</div><div class="col-md-4 text-center">';
                                    if (bShowAd == true) {
                                        // Show advertisement
                                        sHTML += '<div class="infinity-ad empty"></div>'
                                        bShowAd = false;
                                    } else {
                                        bShowAd = true;
                                    }
                                    sHTML += '</div></div><hr>';
                                }
                            }
                        } else {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                // Origin found. Begin displaying assets
                                bFoundOrigin = true;
                            } else {
                                // Origin found is false. Skip asset
                                // Fail-safe in case origin is not present in set. This can be removed when origin is fixed.
                                if (bFirstRun == true) {
                                    // Stored first id
                                    sFirstID = this.id;
                                    bFirstRun = false;
                                } else if (this.id == sFirstID) {
                                    // We've started again. Force origin
                                    sOriginID = sFirstID;
                                    bFoundOrigin = true;
                                } // end Fail-safe
                            }
                        }
                        // Append infinity set to container
                        $("#infinite-container").append(sHTML);
                    });

                    // Include block_id on newly added list items
                    $('#infinite-container .infinite-item.original').each(function() {
                        var sHref = scrubURL($(this).find(".card-headline a").attr("href"));
                        
                        // Add to image and headlines links
                        $(this).removeClass('original')
                            .find(".card-headline a, .image a")
                            .attr("href", sHref + "#tncms-source=infinity-scroll-summary-siderail-latest");
                    });

                    // Check next URL
                    if (sNextUrl) {
                        // if origin hasn't been found yet and we hit next_url. Trigger the set to pull in again.
                        if (bFoundOrigin == false) {
                            // No origin yet. Call the populate function
                            populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                        } else {
                            // Append sNextUrl to infinity set
                            $("#infinite-container").append('<div id="infinite-more" data-next-url="' + sNextUrl + '"><i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i></div>');
                        }
                    }
                    
                        // Ad waypoint and handler to insert ads next to summary
                        $('.infinity-ad.empty').waypoint({
                            offset: '80%',
                            handler: function(direction) {
                                // Kill waypoint
                                this.destroy();
                                $(this.element).removeClass('empty');
                                // Create and append ad iframe. Make sure this occurs only once
                                var newIframe = infinityAd();
                                if($(this.element).children().length <= 0) {
                                    $(this.element).append(newIframe);
                                }
                            }
                        });
                    
                    // Refresh waypoints
                    Waypoint.refreshAll();
                } else {
                    // Empty asset set returned. Go back in for a real set
                    populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                }
            });
        }

        // Infinite waypoint
        var waypoint = new Waypoint({
            element: document.getElementById('infinite-container'),
            handler: function(direction) {
                if (direction == 'down') {
                    if (bInfiniStop == true) {                        
                        // FINISHED. Kill the waypoint
                        this.destroy();
                    } else {
                        // Log waypoint hit event
                        __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'infinity-scroll','action':'request', 'label':'assets requested', 'value': true});
                        var nextURL =  $('#infinite-more').data('next-url');
                        populateInfinitySet($('#infinite-more').data('next-url'));
                    }
                }
            },
            offset: 'bottom-in-view'
        });

        // Infinity ad
        function infinityAd() {
            var newIframe = document.createElement('iframe');
            newIframe.scrolling = 'no';
            newIframe.src = 'http://www.nwitimes.com/tncms/block/1429668/?disableTNStatsTracker=1';
            return newIframe;
        }
        // Rewrite URL to for preview
        function scrubURL(sURL) {
            if (typeof sURL != 'undefined'){
                return sURL;
            }
        }
    </script>

    var lastDate = new Date(__tnt.recent.date.get());
    
    expireDate = expireDate.getTime();
    lastDate = lastDate.getTime();
    
    if(Number(lastDate)<Number(expireDate)){
        __tnt.log("resetting restrictions");
        var nextDate = new Date(expireDate+(__tnt.metering.config.days * 86400000));

        __tnt.recent.count.set(0);
        __tnt.recent.date.set(nextDate.getTime());

    }
});

// Set the 'read' variable if the current asset is in the recent assets list

    var recent = __tnt.recent.assets.get();
    var uuid = __tnt.metering.config.uuid;
    
    var check = false;
    var i = 0;
    while(!check && i < recent.length){
        if(recent[i]==uuid){
            __tnt.log("found asset in recent");
            var check = true;
        }
        i++;
    }    
    
    if(check){
        __tnt.log("user has read this already");

    var cleanedReferrer = String(String(window.document.referrer).split('?')[0]).replace(/https\:\/\/|http\:\/\//,'').replace(/www/,'');
    var check = false;

        var regexp = String(this).replace(/\./g,'\\.').replace(/\,/g,'|');

    });

// increment counter on new assets

            var bloxServiceVerified = $.cookie('tncms-services-verified');

                var bloxServiceIDs = [];
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5003);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5599);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4604);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4624);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4605);

                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4630);
                
                if (__tnt.user.services){
                    var bloxUserServiceIDs = __tnt.user.services.replace('%2C',',').split(',');
                    $.each(bloxUserServiceIDs, function(index, value){
                        var serviceID = parseInt(value);
                        if( serviceID != 0 ){
                            if( $.inArray(serviceID, bloxServiceIDs) > -1 ){
                                bloxHasSubscription = true;
                                return false;
                            }
                        }else{
                            bloxHasSubscription = true;
                            return false;
                        }
                    });
                }
            /* service has been whitelisted */
            } else {
                bloxHasSubscription = true;
            }

            /* check for whitelists once per day */
            if( !bloxHasSubscription && !bloxServiceVerified && typeof userWhiteList != 'undefined' && $.isArray(userWhiteList) ) {
                $.getJSON("http://journalstar.com/_services/v1/client_ip_info",function(data){
                    /* create a range */
                    var dataRange = data.ip.split('.');
                    dataRange = dataRange[0]+'.'+dataRange[1]+'.'+dataRange[2];
                    if( jQuery.inArray(data.ip, userWhiteList) > -1 || jQuery.inArray(dataRange, userWhiteList) > -1 ){
                        /* white list machine */
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 1, { path:'/' });

                        bloxHasSubscription = true;
                    } else {
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 0, { path:'/', expires:1 });
                        
                        __tnt.metering.check();
                    }
                });

            /* no access */
            }else if( !bloxHasSubscription ){
                __tnt.metering.check();
            }
            
            if(bloxHasSubscription){
                $('.subscriber-only.encrypted-content').each(function(){
                    $(this).html(tncms.unscramble($(this).text()));
                    $(this).show();
                });
                $('.subscriber-hide').show();
            }

            // show main content div
            $('#site-container').show();

            // hide loading spinner
            $('.subscriber-load').hide();
        });

<div class="asset-content p402_premium subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>Customers of Hickman's city water system were advised at midday Monday the water supply is safe.</p></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/journalstar.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-top, atf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-top-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><div class="subscriber-preview"><p>City Administrator Silas Clarke rescinded a boil-water notice issued last week after a hole was discovered in the city's water tower. The tower was drained and refilled Friday.</p></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/journalstar.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-middle, stf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-middle-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center "><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/journalstar.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-inline-video, stf" data-dfp-size="[4,1]" data-lazy="true" id="fixed-inline-video" style="min-height:1px; min-width:4px;"></div></div>
<div class="subscriber-only"><p>Samples submitted to the state Department of Health and Human Services tested negative for total coliform and fecal or E.coli bacteria, he said.</p></div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"></div>
</div>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#sticky-right-rail');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="sticky-right-rail-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#tncms-region-global-container-bottom') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#main-bottom-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

<div class="infinity-summary-container hidden-print" id="infinite-container">
<div data-next-url="http://journalstar.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=92fba922-3a3e-541f-9196-c86228baae73&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube" id="infinite-more">
<i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i>
</div>
</div>
<script>
        
            var bFoundOrigin = true;
            var sOriginID = null;
        
        var sOriginURL = scrubURL('http://journalstar.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=92fba922-3a3e-541f-9196-c86228baae73&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube'); // original url scrubbed for preview
        var sFirstID = null;
        var bFirstRun = true;
        var bShowAd = true;
        var bInfiniStop = false;

        function populateInfinitySet(sURL) {
            sURL = scrubURL(sURL);

            // Until the origin paramter for cms.search.mlt functions, we have to start/stop the looping on our own
            // This will require not displaying any assets until we hit oAsset.
            // Then we loop through and display until we've been through everything up to our origin

            $.ajax(sURL).then(function(oResponse, sStatus, oXHR) {

                var sNextUrl = null;

                if (typeof oResponse.next_url == 'undefined') {
                    // URL supplied is no good. Revert to original URL
                    sNextUrl = sOriginURL;
                } else {
                    sNextUrl = scrubURL(oResponse.next_url);
                }

                // Manage response
                if (typeof oResponse.assets != 'undefined' && oResponse.assets.length > 0) {
                    
                    // Remove old more data
                    $("#infinite-more").remove();

                    
                    // Build infinity set
                    $.each(oResponse.assets, function(index) {
                            if (index == 1 && sOriginID == null) {
                                sOriginID = oResponse.assets[0].id;
                            }
                        // Display assets once origin is found
                        if (bFoundOrigin == true) {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                bInfiniStop = true;
                                sNextUrl = null;
                                $("#infinite-more").remove();
                                
                            } else if (bInfiniStop == false && this.id != '92fba922-3a3e-541f-9196-c86228baae73') {
                                // Display asset
                                var sHTML = '';
                                if (this.content) {
                                    sHTML += '<div class="infinite-item original row"><div class="col-md-8">' + this.content + '</div><div class="col-md-4 text-center">';
                                    if (bShowAd == true) {
                                        // Show advertisement
                                        sHTML += '<div class="infinity-ad empty"></div>'
                                        bShowAd = false;
                                    } else {
                                        bShowAd = true;
                                    }
                                    sHTML += '</div></div><hr>';
                                }
                            }
                        } else {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                // Origin found. Begin displaying assets
                                bFoundOrigin = true;
                            } else {
                                // Origin found is false. Skip asset
                                // Fail-safe in case origin is not present in set. This can be removed when origin is fixed.
                                if (bFirstRun == true) {
                                    // Stored first id
                                    sFirstID = this.id;
                                    bFirstRun = false;
                                } else if (this.id == sFirstID) {
                                    // We've started again. Force origin
                                    sOriginID = sFirstID;
                                    bFoundOrigin = true;
                                } // end Fail-safe
                            }
                        }
                        // Append infinity set to container
                        $("#infinite-container").append(sHTML);
                    });

                    // Include block_id on newly added list items
                    $('#infinite-container .infinite-item.original').each(function() {
                        var sHref = scrubURL($(this).find(".card-headline a").attr("href"));
                        
                        // Add to image and headlines links
                        $(this).removeClass('original')
                            .find(".card-headline a, .image a")
                            .attr("href", sHref + "#tncms-source=infinity-scroll-summary-siderail-latest");
                    });

                    // Check next URL
                    if (sNextUrl) {
                        // if origin hasn't been found yet and we hit next_url. Trigger the set to pull in again.
                        if (bFoundOrigin == false) {
                            // No origin yet. Call the populate function
                            populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                        } else {
                            // Append sNextUrl to infinity set
                            $("#infinite-container").append('<div id="infinite-more" data-next-url="' + sNextUrl + '"><i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i></div>');
                        }
                    }
                    
                        // Ad waypoint and handler to insert ads next to summary
                        $('.infinity-ad.empty').waypoint({
                            offset: '80%',
                            handler: function(direction) {
                                // Kill waypoint
                                this.destroy();
                                $(this.element).removeClass('empty');
                                // Create and append ad iframe. Make sure this occurs only once
                                var newIframe = infinityAd();
                                if($(this.element).children().length <= 0) {
                                    $(this.element).append(newIframe);
                                }
                            }
                        });
                    
                    // Refresh waypoints
                    Waypoint.refreshAll();
                } else {
                    // Empty asset set returned. Go back in for a real set
                    populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                }
            });
        }

        // Infinite waypoint
        var waypoint = new Waypoint({
            element: document.getElementById('infinite-container'),
            handler: function(direction) {
                if (direction == 'down') {
                    if (bInfiniStop == true) {                        
                        // FINISHED. Kill the waypoint
                        this.destroy();
                    } else {
                        // Log waypoint hit event
                        __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'infinity-scroll','action':'request', 'label':'assets requested', 'value': true});
                        var nextURL =  $('#infinite-more').data('next-url');
                        populateInfinitySet($('#infinite-more').data('next-url'));
                    }
                }
            },
            offset: 'bottom-in-view'
        });

        // Infinity ad
        function infinityAd() {
            var newIframe = document.createElement('iframe');
            newIframe.scrolling = 'no';
            newIframe.src = 'http://journalstar.com/tncms/block/1414225/?disableTNStatsTracker=1';
            return newIframe;
        }
        // Rewrite URL to for preview
        function scrubURL(sURL) {
            if (typeof sURL != 'undefined'){
                return sURL;
            }
        }
    </script>

<div class="asset-content p402_premium subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>EAST CHICAGO | Citywide water service was shut off Sunday,
forcing schools to be closed Monday, after the early morning
rupture of a primary line from the lakefront filtration plant.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-preview"><p>The School City of East Chicago canceled all Monday classes.
Officials expect to reopen the schools Tuesday at regular
times.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>City offices also will be closed to the public Monday, although
city workers are expected to report to work, according to the
Facebook page for East Chicago's public access TV station. But the
Police and Fire departments and health services will remain open to
residents, the TV station reported.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/nwitimes.com/news/local/lake/east-chicago" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-top, atf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-top-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Thousands of gallons per minute were pouring from the fractured
24-inch main under 141st and Alder streets just north of Columbus
Drive when the break was noticed just before 5 a.m., police
said.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Columbus Drive was closed to westbound traffic at the city
limits at 8 a.m., with just one partially flooded eastbound lane
remaining open Sunday afternoon.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>City officials said residents should boil all water for at least
five minutes before use. Health Department officials notified
restaurants throughout the day that they could not remain open
without running water.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Fire Department tanker trucks stood by St. Catherine Hospital to
keep water in the boilers that heat the 190-bed facility after
supplies were cut off about 8 a.m.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>"We have arranged to use three additional water tankers from
other communities to assure we have the water we would need to
respond to calls," East Chicago Fire Department District Chief Tom
Boyle said.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Water was delivered throughout the day to the Housing
Authority's senior citizens buildings and the Carmelite Home, and
residents could pick up gallons of clean water at the James Knight
Public Safety Facility, said Herbert Cruz, Emergency Management
Agency director.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center "><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/nwitimes.com/news/local/lake/east-chicago" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-inline-video, stf" data-dfp-size="[4,1]" data-lazy="true" id="fixed-inline-video" style="min-height:1px; min-width:4px;"></div></div>
<div class="subscriber-only"><p>"We were going to have to do a boil order anyway," said Mayor
Anthony Copeland, who was at the scene of the break to confer with
emergency responders.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>"So we decided to shut the whole thing down and get it
fixed."</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The city's rapid notification system — a "reverse 911" robocall
network — was activated, Cruz said, and information about the
situation was published on the East Chicago website, cable channel,
Facebook page and Twitter.</p>
</div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/nwitimes.com/news/local/lake/east-chicago" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-middle, stf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-middle-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Copeland said the water might not flow again until Monday
morning.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>"That water main was at least 80 years old," Copeland said.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The city is in the process of surveying all of its water lines,
some of which have been in service for more than a century,
Copeland said.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>He said it's part of an infrastructure upgrade meant to follow
the October opening of a new $52 million water filtration
plant.</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>"We have problems with aging infrastructure," Copeland said.
"We're going to fix those problems."</p>
</div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>For more information and updates, visit the city website at
<a href="http://www.eastchicago.com">www.eastchicago.com</a> or the school district website at
<a href="http://www.scec.k12.in.us/">www.scec.k12.in.us/</a> or call (219) 391-8310.</p>
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-1369863"><section class="block emphasis-h3 dark " id="block-1369863">
<div class="clearfix">
<div class="block-title title-1369863 ">

<a href="http://www.nwitimes.com/subscribenow/?utm_source=direct-link&utm_medium=instory&utm_campaign=subscribenow&utm_term=" target="_blank">
                
                Subscribe to The Times
                
                    </a>
</h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>

            ) {

                    // Check next URL

                        // if origin hasn't been found yet and we hit next_url. Trigger the set to pull in again.
                        if (bFoundOrigin == false) {
                            // No origin yet. Call the populate function
                            populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                        } else {
                            // Append sNextUrl to infinity set
                            $("#infinite-container").append('<div id="infinite-more" data-next-url="' + sNextUrl + '"><i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i></div>');
                        }
                    }
                    
                        // Ad waypoint and handler to insert ads next to summary
                        $('.infinity-ad.empty').waypoint({
                            offset: '80%',
                            handler: function(direction) {
                                // Kill waypoint
                                this.destroy();
                                $(this.element).removeClass('empty');
                                // Create and append ad iframe. Make sure this occurs only once
                                var newIframe = infinityAd();
                                if($(this.element).children().length <= 0) {
                                    $(this.element).append(newIframe);
                                }
                            }
                        });
                    
                    // Refresh waypoints
                    Waypoint.refreshAll();
                } else {
                    // Empty asset set returned. Go back in for a real set
                    populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                }
            });
        }

        // Infinite waypoint
        var waypoint = new Waypoint({
            element: document.getElementById('infinite-container'),
            handler: function(direction) {
                if (direction == 'down') {
                    if (bInfiniStop == true) {                        
                        // FINISHED. Kill the waypoint
                        this.destroy();
                    } else {
                        // Log waypoint hit event
                        __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'infinity-scroll','action':'request', 'label':'assets requested', 'value': true});
                        var nextURL =  $('#infinite-more').data('next-url');
                        populateInfinitySet($('#infinite-more').data('next-url'));
                    }
                }
            },
            offset: 'bottom-in-view'
        });

        // Infinity ad
        function infinityAd() {
            var newIframe = document.createElement('iframe');
            newIframe.scrolling = 'no';
            newIframe.src = 'http://www.nwitimes.com/tncms/block/1429668/?disableTNStatsTracker=1';
            return newIframe;
        }
        // Rewrite URL to for preview
        function scrubURL(sURL) {
            if (typeof sURL != 'undefined'){
                return sURL;
            }
        }
    </script>

Cape: Boil water notice issued for Tuesday

The City of Cape Coral has issued a boil water notice to 228 homes to occur on Tuesday, December 13th.

The Cape Coral Utilities Department will be shutting off the water in a section of Country Club Boulevard south of Archer Parkway in order to repair two problem valves.

The valves have contributed to three waterline breaks this year.

The water will be shut off from 9:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. on Tuesday. All of the homes will be under the boil water notice until clearance is received from the Lee County Health Department.

NBC2 will announce when the boil water notice has been lifted.

Click here to view a map of the affected streets.

Cash Waterworks under precautionary boil water notice

CASH, AR (KAIT) – The Arkansas Department of Health has issued a precautionary boil water notice for the Cash Waterworks System.

According to the ADH, a car hit a fire hydrant which caused pressure loss throughout the system.

The ADH reports the precautionary measure has been issued because of the possibility that contaminated water may have entered the distribution system as a result of the loss in system pressure.

All customers should boil their water briskly for 1 minute prior to use. Also all ice cubes should be discarded and only boiled water used for making ice.

Region 8 News will continue to track this story and let you know when the order has been lifted as soon as we receive the update.

Part of Sellersburg under boil water advisory

By Charles Gazaway, Digital Content Producer
Email
Connect
cgazaway@wave3.com
Follow @wave3news

SELLERSBURG, IN (WAVE) – A boil water advisory is in effect for water customers in part of Sellersburg.

The boil order is expected to remain in effect until sometime Saturday for people who live in the Hill-N-Dale neighborhood.

If you live in the boil water advisory area, you should boil your water for three to five minutes and remember to throw out your ice in your ice makers.

Watervliet water boil advisory lifted

Print Email
Brad Devereaux By Brad Devereaux The Kalamazoo Gazette
Follow on Twitter
on December 04, 2011 at 6:37 PM
comments

WATERVLIET – City officials have announced that the precautionary water boil order for Watervliet City Water customers has been lifted.

Three days of testing for bacteria resulted in negative test results for contamination and the water boil order was discontinued as of noon on Saturday, according to a City of Watervliet news release.

The water boil order and testing was a result of the broken water distribution main that was damaged by constructions crews on Tuesday, Nov. 29, causing a loss of water pressure to portions of the service area.

The water boil order was in effect for all Watervliet City Water system customers including city residents and some Watervliet Township residents.

Contact Brad Devereaux at bdevereaux@kalamazoogazette.com or 269-388-8449 or follow him on Twitter.

<h1 class="trb_ar_hl_t" itemprop="headline">Boulevard diner under "boil water order"</h1>
</div>
</header>
<div class="trb_ar_main">
<div><div class="trb_ar_by"><figure class="trb_ar_by_i_f"><img alt="Caroline Dipping" class="trb_ar_by_i" height="70" src="http://www.trbimg.com/img-57c33643/turbine/sdut-caroline-dipping/70/70x70" srcset="http://www.trbimg.com/img-57c33643/turbine/sdut-caroline-dipping/140/140x140 2x, http://www.trbimg.com/img-57c33643/turbine/sdut-caroline-dipping/210/210x210 3x" title="Caroline Dipping" width="70"/></figure><span class="trb_ar_by_nm_pm"><span class="trb_ar_by_nm_au" data-byline-withoutby=""><a class="trb_ar_by_nm_au_a" href="/sdut-caroline-dipping-staff.html#nt=byline" itemprop="author">Caroline Dipping</a></span><span class="trb_ar_by_b"></span><a class="trb_ar_by_cl" data-role="sc_sEmail" href='mailto:caroline.dipping@utsandiego.com?subject=Regarding: "Boulevard diner under "boil water order""'>Contact Reporter</a></span></div><div class="trb_ar_dateline"><time class="trb_ar_dateline_time" data-dt="December 1, 2011, 4:55 PM" datetime="2011-12-01T16:55:35PST" itemprop="datePublished"></time>
<span class="trb_ar_dateline_line" data-content-dateline="BOULEVARD"></span></div>
</div>
<div class="trb_ar_bd" itemprop="articleBody">
<div class="trb_ar_page" data-content-page="1" data-role="pagination_page">
<p>A boil water order was issued Thursday for the Manzanita Diner in Boulevard.</p><p>The San Diego County Department of Environmental Health issued the order for the restaurant on Old Highway 80 after tests of the drinking water system identified the presence of total coliform bacteria, said department spokesman Mark McPherson. The bacteria can come from soils and other environmental sources and can indicate a problem with the water supply system, he said.</p><div class="trb_gptAd trb_ar_main_ad" data-adloader-adtype="articlebottomcube" data-adloader-label="" data-adloader-position="articleCube" data-adloader-size="300x250" data-role="adloader adloader_ad delayload delayload_done" data-state="adloader_unloaded" data-withinviewport-options="bottomOffset=100"></div><p>Tests performed did not indicate the presence of E. coli, McPherson said.</p><p>The effected system is one of about 170 small drinking water systems that serve the back country, he said. The boil water order will remain in effect until the distribution system has been disinfected and additional samples confirm the absence of bacteria in the water supply. That could be as soon as 24 hours or up to a few days, he said.</p></div>
</div>

Local

Repairs of McHenry Shores water disruption continue

By JOSEPH BUSTOS - jbustos@shawmedia.com

McHENRY – McHenry Shores Water Co. crews and city public works crews had restored water service to many customers Wednesday but continued to work to fix a leak that led to a water disruption in the subdivision.

About 160 customers, or a third of the water company’s customers, were affected by the water service disruption, said T.P. Mathews, owner of the water company.

By Wednesday afternoon, the problem had been isolated to the northeastern corner of the subdivision. Mathews estimated that 40 customers still were without service.

“We haven’t found the real culprit yet,” Mathews said. “We’re working as fast we can.”

Water service was disrupted about 10 a.m. Tuesday. Workers from the water company could not find the leak and stopped searching Tuesday evening. They resumed work to repair the main at dawn Wednesday.

There is a boil order in effect for those with water in McHenry Shores. For those without service, a boil order will be in effect when service returns, the city said in an email alert.

Workers would have been able to work through the night if they had been able to locate the leak, Mathews said.

Jon Schmitt, the city’s public works superintendent, said city crews have been offering technical assistance, along with Illinois Environmental Protection Agency, on trying to find the leak.

Schmitt said the water company had hired a leak-detection company to help pinpoint the leak as well.

“It’s a private water system; they’re responsible to repair it,” Schmitt said. “The city has no jurisdiction over a private water company.”

Mathews had speculated that areas where water mains were near sewer lines might be the problem, but Schmitt said the city checked that possibility and ruled it out.

Schmitt said sewer lines are running as normal.

However many customers were frustrated with the water company’s communication on the issue.

When customers called the water company Tuesday evening to get updates on repairs, they were instructed to call Alderman Richard Wimmer and given his home phone number. McHenry Shores is in Wimmer’s ward.

Some calls to Wimmer went straight to a voicemail Tuesday evening as he fielded calls until midnight. Wimmer said Wednesday that he would return more calls during the evening.

Wimmer received more than 100 messages. Many of them came while he was talking on the phone with residents.

“We’re trying to narrow it down, but there’s no visible leak yet,” Wimmer said.

The city and Mathews have been in long-standing negotiations for the city to buy the water system, but that proposed deal has never gone through. The sticking point has been finalizing a price for the system.

To get through the disruption, Barb Merkel, 54, said she had to buy 10 5-gallon jugs of bottled water to do dishes, cook, wash up and fill toilets.

Merkel said she was frustrated with the company’s communication about the problem, especially when the water company instructed people to call Wimmer.

“If they would just update people, people can deal with the situation if they kept us informed,” Merkel said. “It would be nice if it was city water.”

Stefanie Ledet started a Facebook page to express her frustration with the water company. She has several 5-gallon buckets of hose water to flush toilets in her house and bought bottled water for consumption.

“[Mathews] does not have the resources to meet our needs,” Ledet said. “We’ve had water problems for years, and he’s not addressing them.”

Boil-water order continues for mobile home park

Posted Tuesday, November 29, 2011 7:55 am
Monday November 28, 2011

NEAL P. GOSWAMI

Staff Writer

BENNINGTON -- The Select Board on Monday continued an emergency health order issued last month for the Sunset Mobile Home Park that requires residents to boil their water.

Town officials said they detected E. coli in October after a neighbor of the park complained of water pooling on his property. Water tests conducted by town officials turned up E. coli, which can cause illness when ingested. Park owner John Bushee Jr. was ordered to "shock" the system and notify residents of the health risk.

The Select Board, which also serves as the town's Board of Health, held a public hearing Monday during its regularly scheduled meeting to determine if further action is needed. The board ultimately decided to continue the original health order pending three more clean tests.

Bennington Health Officer Larry McLeod asked the board to require Bushee to hire an engineer to investigate the problem and complete three "clean" tests, followed by monthly testing for one year. He said Bushee had not followed the requirements of the original order. "Because we have 11 units with I don't know how many people, I think we need to err on the side of caution,: McLeod said.

Additionally, a recent water test turned up chlorine which could be used to kill off E. coli and coliform. That does not address potential underlying problems with the private well system that delivers water to the 11 units within the park, he said.

Attorney Brian Marthage, who represented Bushee at the hearing, said several random tests have come back clean since the original test that indicated the presence of E. coli. "One dirty test does not make a public health emergency," he said.

Marthage provided the board with several tests results that showed no presence of E. coli. "Public health is always an important consideration but you need to base your decision on the evidence before you," Marthage said.

Marthage said Bushee used chlorine to flush the system after replaced a water tank.

Park residents Bonita and Colin McKeighan said they believe tainted water caused them to become sick with Giardia, which can cause diarrhea and other problems. "I would like to see something done to guarantee to the people that we have quality water," Bonita McKeighan said.

McLeod said the town will test the water source for chlorine today before testing for contaminants. If chlorine is detected further testing must wait until the chlorine is flushed from the system, he said.

McLeod said if chlorine continues to be detected or if E. coli or coliform is detected, he will appear again before the Select Board and seek additional measures.

Contact Neal P. Goswami at ngoswami@benningtonbanner.com

WATER MAIN BLOWS IN GOLD BAR
Overnight repairs brings water back on in time for turkey day
November 24, 2011




Gold Bar city staffers on the job overnight getting water main break fixed. Photo: city of Gold Bar. CLICK TO ENLARGE


Capped water line. Photo: city of Gold Bar. CLICK TO ENLARGE


Puget Sound energy support. Photo: city of Gold Bar. CLICK TO ENLARGE
(GOLD BAR, WA) -- Gold Bar’s water system was shut down Wednesday due to a break in a water main. The shut down left many in the town of 2,200 with no water supply as many people were making preparations for Thanksgiving dinner on Thursday.

Those who get their water from drinking wells were not affected.

The accident happened shortly after 5 pm when a service line to a fire hydrant in Gold Bar ruptured at the corner of 5th & Lewis Streets, causing a pressure drop and loss of water service to some areas of the City.

Local residents contacted various city personnel about the problem and city staffers including John Light, Public Works Director were called out to work on the problem.

By 6 pm, the Gold Bar Block Watch sent out emails to its recipient list. The emails noted that portions of east Gold Bar are on a separate water system and were not affected by the break.

“The leak was large, filling Lewis Avenue with water. Firefighters from Fire District 26 joined the City staff to help and provided pumping service to clear water from the area,” said a statement from Gold Bar Mayor Joe Beavers.

CHALLENGES DUE TO AGE OF GOLD BAR'S WATER SYSTEM

The water system in Gold Bar dates back to the 1970s and the old records are not accurate for locations of shut-off valves so the city had to test out various combinations of shut-off valves in order to control the leak. Eventually they resorted to shutting down the entire flow system due to various interconnections of service lines that prevented a local shut-off.

Utility Clerk Denise Beaston, acting in her role as liaison with the Department of Emergency Management (DEM), contacted DEM and arranged for a reverse 911 call to the citizens of Gold Bar about the water outage. Also, she made the “Call Before You Dig – 811” for an emergency response.

The line search found that a natural gas line ran parallel to the water main and Puget Sound Energy (PSE) was contacted. Shortly afterwards, a PSE Field Serviceman arrived and work got underway on the repair.

The reverse 911 call went out to the Gold Bar “list” and included residents not serviced by the Gold Bar Municipal Water District.

The break occurred in a line of older vintage and there were no spares that would directly connect to the line and hydrant. The City staff then pulled various parts together to plug the main line and left the hydrant disconnected.

Once the leak was stopped and the water cleared from the streets, work began on the repair.

By 3 am, the broken line was removed and the main line connection capped. Water service was restarted and hydrant flushing began.

By 5 am in the morning, water pressure was restored to all portions of the city.

PROTECTING AGAINST CONTAMINATION IN WATER SUPPLY

The next step was to insure the safety of the water for potable use. Hydrant flushing continued in the morning and then the Seattle Public Works Department was contacted for testing a water sample for bacterial contamination.

While waiting for the water test to be completed, residents were notified by a 911 reverse call to boil all water for potable use. The State Department of Health advises residents to boil tap water used for drinking, brushing teeth, dishwashing, preparing food, and making ice. Water should be boiled for one minute and allowed to cool before use.

“Special commendations are in order for the Gold Bar City Staff who worked 12 straight hours on Thanksgiving Eve to bring the water system back into operation. The work continued on into Thanksgiving morning with hydrant flushing and water sample testing,” said Mayor Beavers.

The problem of old utility infrastructure plagues many municipalities. Recently, the Startup Water District was able to obtain a grant to replace their old in-ground infrastructure.

The Gold Bar Municipal Water District is currently upgrading its reservoir system with a new 300,000 gallon reservoir, new back-up generator, updated monitoring equipment, and some new mains. That work is scheduled to be completed by early Spring. The costs to upgrade the old in-ground infrastructure are being evaluated as part of the current update of the Water Comprehensive Plan.
